001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Abstraction.TemporalState;
004
005/**
006 * Any data related to the state of the people in the model which is valid only
007 * in a specific time point. This list of things is shared between the
008 * {@link PersonState} and {@link PersonHistory}.
009 */
010public interface PersonTemporalState extends TemporalState<Person> {
011
012        /**
013         * The viral exposure an individual experienced in a day as a result of all
014         * contacts in the model. This value is accumulated from {@link Contact}
015         * events and may also include a random chance of exposure due to
016         * importation, as defined by the simulation's contact and importation
017         * models. This value should be on the same scale as the
018         * {@link #getNormalisedViralLoad() viral load} for consistent comparison.
019         * This value is derived from the contact network and the in-host models and
020         * is computed from the person's history (thus it is one day behind during
021         * the update pass).
022         *
023         * @return The total viral exposure for the day, which may be 0 if no
024         *         exposure occurred.
025         */
026        double getContactExposure();
027
028        /**
029         * A continuous value for the severity of disease, as determined by the
030         * in-host model. This value is interpreted relative to disease cutoffs,
031         * which are calibrated during the model setup (e.g., in
032         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
033         * SetupConfiguration}). It is not strictly normalized but provides a
034         * relative measure of disease progression.
035         *
036         * @return A severity value, where higher values indicate more severe
037         *         disease. The interpretation of this value is relative to
038         *         predefined thresholds for symptoms, hospitalisation, and
039         *         mortality.
040         */
041        double getNormalisedSeverity();
042
043        /**
044         * A continuous value for the viral load of disease, as determined by the
045         * in-host model. This is scaled such that it is 0 if uninfected and 1 if
046         * minimally infectious. Values smaller than 1 imply that viral load may be
047         * detectable by tests but not necessarily infectious. This scaling may be
048         * revisited to more formally relate viral load with infectivity, potentially
049         * referencing parameters in
050         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
051         * SetupConfiguration}.
052         *
053         * @return A normalized viral load value, where 0 indicates no infection and
054         *         1 indicates the threshold for minimal infectivity, it has no upper
055         *         bound. Values between 0 and 1 represent varying levels of viral
056         *         load, with higher values indicating greater potential infectivity.
057         */
058        double getNormalisedViralLoad();
059
060        /**
061         * An estimate of the local prevalence as perceived by a smart agent,
062         * calculated based on the probability of infection in today's contacts. This
063         * estimation typically involves aggregating information from observed
064         * contacts and applying a heuristic or model to infer local infection rates.
065         * Estimate local prevalence for an individual as the average presumed
066         * probability infectious across detected contacts. If there are no detected
067         * contacts a small non-zero floor is returned to avoid zero prevalence
068         * issues in downstream calculations.
069         *
070         * @return a probability value representing the smart agent's estimate of
071         *         local prevalence ,
072         */
073        double getPresumedLocalPrevalence();
074
075        /**
076         * The incubation period as currently estimated by the model, which may not
077         * be the true biological value. This value is retrieved from the
078         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelNav#modelState(PersonTemporalState)
079         * model's presumed incubation period}, which is typically sourced from the
080         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
081         * SetupConfiguration}.
082         *
083         * @return The estimated incubation period in days.
084         */
085        default int incubPeriod() {
086                return ModelNav.modelState(this).getPresumedIncubationPeriod();
087        }
088
089        /**
090         * The infectious period as currently estimated by the model, which may not
091         * be the true biological value. This is calculated by summing the
092         * {@link #incubPeriod() incubation period} and the
093         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelNav#modelState(PersonTemporalState)
094         * model's presumed infectious period}, which is typically sourced from the
095         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
096         * SetupConfiguration}.
097         *
098         * @return The estimated infectious period in days.
099         */
100        default int infPeriod() {
101                return this.incubPeriod()
102                                + ModelNav.modelState(this).getPresumedInfectiousPeriod();
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * Determines if the person is deceased. This state is typically set when the
107         * person's disease severity surpasses a mortality threshold or a specific
108         * mortality event occurs within the simulation, as defined in the in-host
109         * model and {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration()
110         * Outbreak's SetupConfiguration}.
111         *
112         * @return {@code true} if the person is dead, {@code false} otherwise.
113         */
114        boolean isDead();
115
116        /**
117         * Indicates if this {@link PersonTemporalState} represents the first day of
118         * a new exposure episode. An incident exposure is typically defined as the
119         * first day a person experiences any {@link Exposure} after a period of no
120         * exposure, or after a sufficiently long period to consider it a new
121         * episode, as determined by the simulation's exposure tracking logic.
122         *
123         * @return {@code true} if this is an incident exposure, {@code false}
124         *         otherwise.
125         */
126        boolean isIncidentExposure();
127
128        /**
129         * Indicates if this {@link PersonTemporalState} represents the first day the
130         * person becomes infectious in a new infection episode. This is distinct
131         * from merely being exposed. An incident infection occurs when the person's
132         * {@link #getNormalisedViralLoad()} crosses the infectivity threshold for
133         * the first time in a given infection cycle, as defined by the in-host model
134         * and {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
135         * SetupConfiguration}.
136         *
137         * @return {@code true} if this is an incident infection, {@code false}
138         *         otherwise.
139         */
140        boolean isIncidentInfection();
141
142        /**
143         * Determines if the person's internal viral load is above the threshold for
144         * potential infectivity. This is calculated by comparing the value returned
145         * by {@link #getNormalisedViralLoad()} against a predefined infectivity
146         * threshold, which is typically configured within the
147         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
148         * SetupConfiguration}. A person is considered infectious if their normalized
149         * viral load surpasses this threshold.
150         *
151         * @return {@code true} if the person is infectious, {@code false} otherwise.
152         */
153        boolean isInfectious();
154
155        /**
156         * The user has reported symptoms via the app. This combines the true
157         * symptomatic state and app use for the day and therefore represents an
158         * observed report; it is used in prevalence estimates and contact
159         * notification, typically through a smart agent mechanism. This state is
160         * dependent on {@link #isSymptomatic()} being true and the person actively
161         * reporting their symptoms based on their behavioral model.
162         *
163         * @return {@code true} if the person is symptomatic and has reported it,
164         *         {@code false} otherwise.
165         */
166        boolean isReportedSymptomatic();
167
168        /**
169         * Determines if the person's disease severity is high enough to require
170         * hospitalisation. This is calculated by comparing the value returned by
171         * {@link #getNormalisedSeverity()} against a predefined hospitalisation
172         * threshold, which is typically configured within the
173         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
174         * SetupConfiguration}.
175         *
176         * @return {@code true} if the person requires hospitalisation, {@code false}
177         *         otherwise.
178         */
179        boolean isRequiringHospitalisation();
180
181        /**
182         * Determines if the person's internal infected targets are above the
183         * threshold for exhibiting symptoms. This is calculated by comparing the
184         * value returned by {@link #getNormalisedSeverity()} against a predefined
185         * symptom threshold, which is typically configured within the
186         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak#getSetupConfiguration() Outbreak's
187         * SetupConfiguration}.
188         *
189         * @return {@code true} if the person is symptomatic, {@code false}
190         *         otherwise.
191         */
192        boolean isSymptomatic();
193}
